text:
Hi everyone,

I hope this message finds you well. We are seeking assistance with an issue that has arisen following our transition from using Hapikey (v2 version) to a Private App (v3 version) for our API calls. Since making this change, we have encountered a problem with tracking Google and Facebook leads in our HubSpot contacts list.

Previously, when we used a [specific code], tracking for contacts originating from Google functioned correctly for v2 version. However, after switching to v3 version, the tracking no longer seems to differentiate properly between Google and Facebook leads. Instead, [specific code] appears to aggregate contacts from both sources under a single filter in the HubSpot contacts list, particularly under the "Original source drill-down 2" filter option.

Could you please help us resolve this issue so that we can correctly track and differentiate leads coming from Google and Facebook separately as we did before?

Thank you in advance for your help and support.

Hi I face a problem on create or retrieve contacts +"status": "error"
  +"message": "Unable to infer object type from: contacts."

Hi, anyone else experiencing issues with the HubSpot API? At my company, we use the HubSpot Email APi to send in email content and send emails via an external tool via our HubSpot account. We have been using this API with no issues for quite a few years now, but all of a sudden we are getting the following errors:

message":"The rate limit for this endpoint has been exceeded.","status":"error"

with no ryme or reason. There is no policy given in the response as to why it has been rate limited and it is causing us issues with our Editorial content emails getting sent out to our users across all of our publishing brands.

The endpoint in quesion:
marketing-emails/v1/emails/{{emailIDhere}}/publish-action

We have the API rate add-on, so we can do:
Burst: 200/10 seconds
Daily: 1,000,000
on our API calls, and we are WELL under that limit, yet we are constantly getting these errors with only a small amount of emails getting sent out if we are lucky.

We use a Private App to make these calls to our account with oAuth, and the volume of calls is in line with what we have been doing now for some qutie time. There has not been any increase that would justify this error whatsoever. Today for example, we have made just over 200 API calls, and every single one fails on that one endpoint - causing the content coming in from the external system to just sit in draft, as it fails to do the publishing/sending of the email.

Support haven't been much help yet, and I have also posted this in the developer forum and raised with out account manager, as this is a serious issue for us

Hello everyone :wave:,
I'm working on extracting feedback submissions from the HubSpot API and encountering some issues. I'm using this endpoint to fetch data:
`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/feedback_submissions?properties=survey_id,record_id,response_date,respondent_project>`
While stakeholders are able to export this data into a file format, indicating that the data exists, my API calls aren't returning all the expected properties. For example, here's a typical response I get:

```{
    "id": "47448785650",
    "properties": {
        "hs_createdate": "2022-07-13T07:44:31.294Z",
        "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2022-07-13T07:44:31.294Z",
        "hs_object_id": "47448785650"
    },
    "propertiesWithHistory": {},
    "createdAt": "2022-07-13T07:44:31.294Z",
    "updatedAt": "2022-07-13T07:44:31.294Z",
    "archived": false
}```
As you can see, it doesn't include the properties I specified in the query. We have about five custom surveys created; does this endpoint not access all survey data, or am I missing something?
Has anyone else experienced this issue, or does anyone have advice on how to ensure all custom properties are returned in the API response?
Thanks in advance for any help!

Hello, I'm attempting to send emails through <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/transactional/single-email/send> but I'm getting an error saying "certificate has expired". How do I resolve this error?

Hi everyone, I'm trying to generate an API key. On the documentation here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/integrations/how-do-i-get-my-HubSpot-api-key> there is no option for me to click Integrations -> API Key. The only options for Integrations are 1. Connected Apps, 2. Private Apps or 3. Email Service Provider. Also when I search API in the settings search bar, the page that it links to says the page is nowhere to be found. Am I missing something?
In my case, I was using a docker container. I updated my node version to the latest version and this issue got resolved.
Hey Isabelle, you need to create a private app and use the access token for the API key to test the on browser API calls.
Can you try this endpoint and see if these are the names of the properties?

Thanks for your response. 'm just trying to read the data, not alter it anyway. It seems that now this is giving me access issues. Do I need oauth for this API? I've been using a private app and the normal access token for all my other calls
```associations_url = f'<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{contact_id}/associations/notes>'


Failed to retrieve associations: 401 {"status":"error","message":"Authentication credentials not found. This API supports OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>",".....```

Hello folks
I noticed that the when I create a new contact, in the first seconds the *updateAt* value changes frequently.
I created <https://gist.github.com/victorabarros/359efea6a8de76650d2d61a88a5116a5|this script to reproduce the bug>, as you can see in the logs after creating a new contact in the first 12˜15 seconds the *updatedAt* value changed up to 4 times..
Sounds about right. Is it impacting your project?
I'm also using a private app and the access token from it to fetch the data, so it should work as you expect
